definition: to act as a substitute/to act on sb's behalf
to substitute/to act on behalf of others/to replace/generation/dynasty/age/period/(historical) era/(geological) eon
row/line/commercial firm/line of business/profession/to rank (first, second etc) among one's siblings (by age)/(in data tables) row/(Tw) column

to walk/to go/to travel/a visit/temporary/makeshift/current/in circulation/to do/to perform/capable/competent/effective/all right/OK!/will do/behavior/conduct/Taiwan pr. [xing4] for the behavior-conduct sense

sentences.english: He authorized me to act for him while he is abroad.
sentences.chinese: 他授權我在他出國期間代行他的職務。

sentences.english: He confidentially authorized me to act for him while he is abroad.
sentences.chinese: 他信任地委託我在他出國期間代行他的事務。

sentences.english: Reported that the day of the Japanese cabinet decided to act by the Crown temporary affairs.
sentences.chinese: 報道稱，日本內閣當天決定由皇太子臨時代行國事。

sentences.english: Li Kun has been replaced as president by Fan Cheng, the airline's Communist party secretary.
sentences.chinese: 李昆總裁一職已由該公司黨委書記樊澄代行。
